lustre/include/lustre_ver.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef _LUSTRE_VER_H_
00002 #define _LUSTRE_VER_H_
00003 
00004 /*
00005  * LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING
00006  *
00007  * Note that some files may seem to include this header unnecessarily.
00008  * If the file uses LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING, it is likely doing the include
00009  * for compatibility with the Lustre code in the Linux kernel.
00010  * In the Linux kernel, they are likely hard coding LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING
00011  * right here in this file.  The out-of-kernel Lustre code generates
00012  * LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING in autoconf with AC_DEFINE.
00013  */
00014 
00015 #define OBD_OCD_VERSION(major, minor, patch, fix)                       \
00016         (((major) << 24) + ((minor) << 16) + ((patch) << 8) + (fix))
00017 
00018 #define OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(version)  ((int)((version) >> 24) & 255)
00019 #define OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(version)  ((int)((version) >> 16) & 255)
00020 #define OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(version)  ((int)((version) >>  8) & 255)
00021 #define OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(version)    ((int)((version) >>  0) & 255)
00022 
00023 #define LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE                                             \
00024         OBD_OCD_VERSION(LUSTRE_MAJOR, LUSTRE_MINOR, LUSTRE_PATCH, LUSTRE_FIX)
00025 
00026 /* liblustre clients are only allowed to connect if their LUSTRE_FIX mismatches
00027  * by this amount (set in lustre/autoconf/lustre-version.ac). */
00028 #define LUSTRE_VERSION_ALLOWED_OFFSET OBD_OCD_VERSION(0, 0, 1, 32)
00029 
00030 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00031 /* If lustre version of client and servers it connects to differs by more
00032  * than this amount, client would issue a warning.
00033  * (set in lustre/autoconf/lustre-version.ac) */
00034 #define LUSTRE_VERSION_OFFSET_WARN OBD_OCD_VERSION(0, 4, 50, 0)
00035 #endif
00036 
00037 #endif
